thread.title: Man steals $1,700 Fender guitar by stuffing it in his pants | New York Post
thread.title_full: Man steals $1,700 Fender guitar by stuffing it in his pants | New York Post

author: Lia Eustachewich
title: Man steals $1,700 Fender guitar by stuffing it in his pants | New York Post
text:
A man brazenly made off with a $1,700 Fender guitar from a shop in Texas — by stuffing it in his pants.
Police in Fort Worth are now looking for the thief after he was caught on surveillance video at Guitar Center Jan. 18 shoving the Tobacco Sunburst Fender into his pants and concealing the neck of the guitar under his shirt.
“I mean who can stuff an entire guitar down their jacket and make it out of the store? It’s kind of hard to believe,” Officer Tamara Valle told ABC affiliate WFAA .
A store manager told police he believes the musical marauder first came into the store to hide the guitar before returning to retrieve it, WFAA said.
In the video, the man is wearing a dark-colored baseball cap, bright red vest and black track suit with white stripes. He ducks behind a display rack, picks up the guitar and, a few seconds later, adjusts his shirt. He slowly walks out of the store with his hands in his pockets.
“You figure somebody would see it immediately but watch that video,” said Valle.
